favourite.article: Lovely hymn. Especially "Oh magnify the Lord with me" I'm a proud member of the church of Nigeria Anglican communion.
The words in this hymns is really up lifting "Fear Him, ye saints and you will then have nothing to fear".
Lovely hymn. Planning to sing at our Silver wedding (25 years) We have achieved nothing without Him. He's Almighty God, Never failing Father, Prince of Peace.
This hymn really lifts up the soul of anyone who listens to it. May God bless all those who made this hymn. God bless us all including those who read this comment.

I plea with all methodist Church choir world wide to sing this hymm for me both my birthday and deathday. For whether I live or die all for God He who is my Lord my life my way and my end. 7th December my birthday God bless you the writer, the choristers and every member of methodist Church

The most inspiring music on which one can really rely for peace, hope, success, prosperity and let alone food for daily life. Blessed be to the Lord Almighty, make you His service your delight, Your wants shall be His care, AMEN.
One of the hymns I like so much every now and then the words keep on repeating in my ears. Soul searching and soul inspiring. Indeed He is our provider.
Wonderful hymn. I see heaven glory listening to this song.
Making Him my service and my want shall be His care. I'm indeed blessed.
Every year on my birthday, this song always comes to mind, that God has been indeed faithful. I love this hymn so much.
I love this song so much, I can feel it. Thanks to my music teacher at Yaa Asatewaa Girls.
I just love this song. It's so powerful. God bless the writer. It's soul uplifting.

What a mighty God we serve. He can glorify and lift us up with words alone. What is different is these words are infused with His Holy Spirit and His strength and commitment through all the changing scenes. Alleluia!!
What a song, song that always lift the Almighty God higher than anybody else. This shows that God is great and sufficient for all. Amen.
How true the words of this hymn! Praise be to God!
In fact, this is my favorite hymn. I'm a methodist. This hymn encourages me whenever I am in spirit.
Praise God for this song....strengthens my faith and strength through all the changes scenes of my life.
This is an amazing hymn. Incredibly soothing!! It overcomes you with some serenity.
Through it all in life God has been faithful and I sing this song as a sign of gratitude.
I love this song so much, God bless the writer.
My all time favorite!! It sums it up for me; the changing scenes, trusting and leaning on the word of God and His faithfulness at all times!! Our God is all powerful !!
This song heals me when I'm downhearted.
My favourite hymn: summarizes God's presence in my life.
This hymn inspires me a lot.
Definitely through all times, joy or pain, we should always praise our Maker. Very nice hymn.
Ohhh this song. A true testimony of my life. This is the song I live by... Whenever in distress, I sing this song and GOD's peace comforts me.
This hymn is so inspiring and it reminds me of God's faithfulness, especially the last verse that speaks of His provision.
I'm glad to know that hymns still inspire and console so many people. The words of this hymn puts me in a calm place. God bless the writer.
Thanks Lilly, this song has lifted my spirit. I sing it anytime when in the spirit of the Lord. It has brought tears to my eyes. I am glad your mother gave you that, because it is in the family.
I really love this hymn. It inspires me most.
Missing my watch night service back home. A must service hymn of the night!

What more can I do than to exalt His name......through all the changing scenes of 2013, in trouble and in joy, the Lord has been merciful. His praise will continually be on my lips. The hymn summarises it all.
I love this hymn so dearly, have not heard it for a very long time. Cannot get it out of my head. I hear it in my head during the night, songs of praise.

Have been hearing this song within my spirit since dawn and one stanza that kept on repeating itself is 3. Indeed the host of God or His angels encamp around the dwelling of the just. My family and I are a living testmony to this. Thank You Abba Father.

I love this song not only because of its lyrics but the where its says "make you His service your delight and He will make your wont His Care" .The Truth is what do I want more than God? And if He is going to Care for my want by just doing His will then God I won't stop doing Your work. Dear reader, this is not only a song but the whole Bible as well. Stay Blessed by making His Service your delight.
My mom loved the song. Am singing it now to feel better. The aftermath of a divorce.
My dad used to sing this song a lot when I was young. It recently came to my mind and brought tears to my eyes....
This hymn is full of the Spirit of God and it's so touching to the soul of the believer. l feel so good listening to it. God bless you. Just listen to the words and your spirit will rejoice.
This hymn brings joy to my heart anytime I sing, read the words or listen to it. It's really an inspirational hymn. I love it.

An inspiring hymn. The words in it gave me all the assurance I needed when things became very difficult for me some years ago. Now I look back and I sing it with so much joy. Brethren please listen and focus on the words and you will hear the voice of the LORD speaking to you. Will forever remain one of my best hymns.

I once overlooked this song as we sang it almost every time whether at church or at rehearsal, until I was called to do an exposition of Psalm 34, that was when I came to appreciate the words of the song. The words are deep and make us understand that in all our circumstances - whether in joy or pain, we have to praise our Maker. The hosts of God will still dwell with us as we are just and we obey Him. In all situations, He is with us and as we obey Him and delight in His service, our wants will surely be His cares. What a blessed assurance!!

This was a song I loved and cherished so much years back when I was a Methodist. Unfortunately I forgot this song because it's uncommon to hear it in Pentecostal churches where I am now. I received bad text mesage this morning and while narrating and expressing my pain to a friend, the song quickly dropped into my spirit. I began singing it on the phone and cut the conversation. After searching and going through all the verses of the song, I was relieved and comforted. I've now typed all the verses unto my iPad and will carry it with me.
Love this song so much. It reassures me of God being there for me always.
Am always filled with peace and joy whenever I sing irrespective listen to this song. I was healed through this song when I had a broken heart. this is one of the most finest song I ve come across.

As a young Ghanaian traveler and a Methodist, my mom made me understood these words of Charles Wesley's hymn. Mom explained that it a song I can sing at all times and the presence of the Lord will never depart from me. Tears fill my eyes anytime I sing this hymn (whether Happy or Sad) and they flow in abundance on hitting the second Stanza:
Oh, magnify the Lord with me, With me exalt His name; When in distress to Him I called, He to my rescue came.
I love the hymn.
The words in this song is very uplifting help to restore hope and comfort to a broken heart. The Lord is always available.
A brilliant hymn of praise, God's love and security, and the truth that life - like God - is wonderfully dynamic!
I attended a presbytarian secondary school in Ghana. This hymn was my favourite then.
This is my very best of best hymns. It talks to me in a special way and always lifts me up when I am down.
OMG......my very best hymn. Love it to the fullest.
This hymn is very inspirational It has so much meaning. It just moves me when I hear it. God is such a great God.

Thank you very much for the inspiring hymn. I was singing it this morning and so I search the web and found it. I am currently going through difficult times, but thanks be to God He is in control, so I will continue to praise Him. God bless you.
This hymn is very special to me, I learnt it back in school but whenever I sing it, my spirit is lifted.
Oh yes indeed, in all ups and downs of life's journey, I will continue to let the praises of my Creator be in my heart. This hymn always gives me joy in the when I hear or sing it.

This is a priceless yesteryear hymn that still has contemporary underpinnings. It is a constant reminder to us that GOD is a GOD of comfort and a surcease in time of trials and tribulations. And boy, are we buffetted about with the vagaries of today's society and the vicissitudes of life! We are so grateful that our LORD is a "covert from storm and from rain" - ISAIAH 4:6, of these perilous times and the waning days of this earth's existence. This hymn has been a favorite of my mother (who is 21 years deceased) and now is included in my "favorites" column.

I really love this song as it reminds me of God's love to us. God is always in control and with us all of our lives no matter what we are going through. Lo I am with you always. Let everything that hath breath praise the Lord.
A very prayerful hymn, that make one aware that no condition is Permanent.
With this hymn, I will forever be grateful.
What a blessing this site is. I use the music just to move me into a mode of worship. Praise His Holy name.
I am blessed reading these hymns daily and singing my heart out to the Lord Jesus Christ. I am blessed each day after singing one hymn.

Verse 2 of this hymn shows us how to even continue to exalt the name of my Maker in even difficult situations, because He will surely rescue me. It means He is aware of the situation. It makes me to rejoice rather than cry and worry. In fact it strengthens me.
I love this song. It is very inspiring to me. When I attend our church then in Nigeria Anglican, Festac town Nigeria. It is always in my heart till today.
Each time I sing this inspiring song, I feel the presence of Almighty God and His ability to take me above my challenges.
One of the most inspiring hymns ever to have been recorded. It shows God's immeasurable love through all the trials and temptations.

I love this hymn because it is a reminder to us that no matter what problems we face in life we should still give thanks and praise to our God. He will never let us down. He is almighty and underneath His wings are the everlasting arms.
This song ministered to me in a difficult season in my life. It made me realise the power in classical hymns.

This is a song that comforts me and often reminds me that regardless of what is happening God is still in control. It is a good thing to remember that praises to God must never cease. Let everything that hath breath praise God.
This song is from Psalm 34.
